moves.1... Nf6: an unconventional opening from my point of view...
moves.2. e3 d5 3. Nc3: The first battle is for the control of the center.
moves.3... Ng4: The attack on e3 is expected
moves.4... e5: so now the decision...for the center of the board...
moves.6. dxe5: still black, although white is more developed...
moves.8. Qxd8+: Yep...I think that the game is more interesting without queens on occasion..
moves.8... Kxd8: and his king is castle proof...
moves.9. Bg5+: so get the major pieces out and about
moves.9... f6 10. exf6: this is a fun aspect of the pawn game..pushing pawns to the end...
moves.10... Re8: I think that this might have been the turning point in the game...
moves.11. f7+: Presently I am one point up...
moves.11... Be7 12. Bxe7+: So my hope here is that the Castle captures the Bishop
moves.13. g3: But I failed to do the next thing..QUEEN...what was I thinking?
moves.14. Nxe4: so I have given him a way out and now I have to dig deep...
moves.15... Bb7 16. Rd1+: so I have to get serious here....
moves.16... Nd7 17. O-O: Castling is key in this situation...
moves.17... c5 18. Nd6: So I have to mobilize to corner his king and mate him now that I have given him an out
moves.18... Bxg2: WHAT - I am really not paying attention at all...
moves.19. Kxg2: OK, still one point up ...still hope..
moves.19... Re7: The board is not organized...I need to get both castles and both knights going...
moves.20. Rfe1: his castle is a problem for me though
moves.21... Kc7: I think there is a way
moves.25. Nd5: depending on what he does next..its game over...
moves.26. Nec7: good plan!...so if he moves his Castle over...
